conclusion: To find the potential difference U_ab between ends a and b of the conductor rod.
The rod rotates with a constant angular velocity ω.
The linear velocity v of any point on the rod at a distance r from the axis of rotation is given by v = ωr.
The induced EMF in a moving conductor in a magnetic field is given by EMF = B ⋅ v ⋅ L.
Integrate the EMF over the length of the rod from 0 to 4L: U_ab = ∫_0^4L B ⋅ ωr dr.
Perform the integration: U_ab = Bω ∫_0^4L r dr.
Calculate the result of the integration: U_ab = Bω [r^2/2]_0^4L.
The potential difference U_ab is U_ab = 8BL^2ω.
